Present location: INSTITUT DE PAPYROLOGIE ET D'ÉGYPTOLOGIE, UNIVERSITÉ DE LILLE III [02/049] LILLE
Name: Jar
Description: Small ovoid jar, almost truncated in shape, which was found at the head of the deceased in a Classic Kerma burial. The vessel is neckless and edged by a flared convex lip.  The object was imported form Egypt and was made from a fine calcareous clay, pink-orange in colour, which contains numerous white calcareous ground minerals. The polishing was very carefully applied.
